t: A psalm of David. When he was in the Wilderness of Judah.
God,*pn you are my God; I eagerly seek you. I*ln thirst for you; my*ln body faints for you in*ln a land that is dry, desolate, and without water.
So*ln I gaze on you in the sanctuary to*ln see your strength and your glory.
My*pn lips will glorify you because*ln your faithful love is better than life.
So*ln I will bless you as long as I live; at*ln your name, I will lift up my hands.
You*ln satisfy me as with rich food; my*ln mouth will praise you with joyful lips.
When*pn I think of you as I lie on my bed, I*ln meditate on you during the night watches
because*ln you are my helper; I*ln will rejoice in the shadow of your wings.
I*ln follow close to you; your*ln right hand holds on to me.
But*pn those who intend to destroy my life will*ln go into the depths of the earth.
They*ln will be given over to the power of the sword; they*ln will become a meal for jackals.
But*ln the king will rejoice in God; all*ln who swear by him will boast, for*ln the mouths of liars will be shut.
